meanings.definition: To implant a microchip in (an animal or object) for tracking or identification purposes.
meanings.sent1: The vet microchipped the stray cat to help find its owner.
meanings.sent2: The shelter microchipped all the adopted dogs before sending them to their new homes.
meanings.sent3: I wonder if aliens would microchip their pets for intergalactic tracking.
meanings.sent4: In the digital age, it feels like we are all microchipped by our smartphones.
meanings.sent5: The idea of being microchipped like a pet sounds both futuristic and unsettling.

meanings.definition: Having a microchip implanted for tracking or identification purposes.
meanings.sent1: The microchipped cat was quickly reunited with its worried owner.
meanings.sent2: All the microchipped items in the store were scanned for inventory purposes.
meanings.sent3: The microchipped dog felt like a secret agent with its hidden tracking device.
meanings.sent4: She felt as secure as a microchipped package, knowing her location was always known.
meanings.sent5: The microchipped passport made international travel smoother and more secure.
